results:
Based on my search results, I've found comprehensive information about the 1962 film "To Kill a Mockingbird" starring Gregory Peck, its Academy Awards recognition, and Polish language availability:

## Academy Awards/Oscar Information:

The film was awarded three Academy Awards, including Best Actor and Best Adapted Screenplay, and was nominated for eight, including Best Picture, Best Director, and Best Supporting Actress.(no content)1963 Winner Oscar · Best Actor in a Leading Role · Gregory Peck · 1963 Nominee Oscar · Best Actress in a Supporting Role · Mary Badham · 1963 Nominee Oscar · Best Director · Robert Mulligan · 1963 Winner Oscar · Best Writing, Screenplay Based on Material from Another Medium · Horton Foote(no content)He won an Academy Award for his performance as Atticus Finch in To Kill a Mockingbird (1962) after four previous nominations and received the Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award in 1968.

The film won three Oscars in total:
1. Best Actor - Gregory Peck
2. Best Adapted Screenplay - Horton Foote  
3. Best Art Direction (Black and White) - Henry Bumstead, Alexander Golitzen, and Oliver Emert

For his iconic portrayal of Atticus Finch, Peck earned his only Oscar for acting, after four previous nominations.

## Polish Subtitles and Dubbing Information:

The film is available with Polish language options:

DTS 2.0 polski (lektor) Andrzej Gajda (448 kbps)

This indicates that the film has Polish voiceover narration (lektor) performed by Andrzej Gajda. napisy: angielskie, portugalskie, polskie, rosyjskie, hiszpańskie, greckie, koreańskie. - The Blu-ray release includes Polish subtitles among other languages.

Zabić drozda (1962) To Kill a Mockingbird - Stan Alabama, lata trzydzieste XX. wieku. Adwokat Atticus Finch zostaje obrońcą czarnego mężczyzny oskarżonego o gwałt na białej kobiecie. The film is known in Poland as "Zabić drozda" (literally "To Kill a Thrush").

Subtitles: ‏ : ‎ English, German, Portuguese, French, Turkish, Polish, Swedish, Danish, Dutch, Hungarian, Finnish, Czech, Bulgarian - Various releases of the film include Polish subtitles.

The film has been available in Poland with both Polish subtitles and Polish voiceover narration (lektor), which is a common form of dubbing in Poland where a single narrator reads all dialogue over the original soundtrack.
